caption: Conviction. Courage. Care.These guide our work as CaptainsOfLives as we inspire change in inmates. We all have a story. What will yours be?Interested in a career with the Singapore Prison Service?Find out more at: SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances PrisJoinUs Careers CaptainsOfLives WhatsYourStory?

I am grateful for Maam Karen Wong from the for walking with me through my incarceration and beyond.She believed in me at a time when I had completely lost faith in myself. She moved mountains to create opportunities for me to contribute as a peer supporterand through that, I was able to find purpose again and rescript my story from within prison walls.She didnt just open doors, she made sure I had the support I needed to walk through them. She showed up for the work, yesbut more than that, she showed up for me.Maam Karen made time to attend and celebrate my milestones. She was always ready for heart-to-heart conversations, never just about tasks or performance, but because she truly cared about us as people.Because of her, Ill soon be sharing about my peer support journey at a rehabilitation seminar. Who wouldve thought?I wouldnt be who I am todayconfident, healing, and still becomingif not for Maam Karen. Matthew Au (Restorative Practices Facilitator, .sg, .SG Companion Writer) .SG is a national movement for Singapore, celebrating the joy we find when we walk with each other. Follow us for more stories and the music video by ._ for NDP. Photo featuring Matthew and Maam Karen Wong at the rehabilitation seminarSG60 waystowalk walkwithyouSG

At the CARE Network Summit and Correctional Practice and Research Symposium 2025, close to 500 partners came together to chart the next chapter of rehabilitation and reintegration in Singapore. The summit saw the launch of the CARE Network's fiveyear workplan and featured practicebased research sessions that will inform future interventions. Our community partners' voices remind us that rehabilitation is a collective journey built on trust, shared experience and enduring hope. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances CARENetwork

How can we work together to support our youths, so that they can be the best versions of themselves? This year, as part of SG60, SPS partnered and to engage and bring new programmes for reformative trainees at Institution Tanah Merah. and conducted a series of workshops where reformative trainees worked with mentors to plan for life after their release, and the actions they can take to achieve them. SG60 is about Building Our Singapore Together, and how all of us can contribute to a Singapore that we will proudly call home. This initiative will also contribute to the SG Youth Plan - a five-year action plan created by youths, for youths, and supported by the whole of society. SPS SingaporePrisonService CaptainsOfLives SG4SecondChances BeyondPrisonWalls BehindPrisonWalls FromStereotypestoArchetypes AOLSG MCCY nycsg SG60 SGYouthPlan

"The biggest challenge is often the one within."Freddy Wee knows this all too well. A former drug abuser who found faith during his time in prison, he now serves as Deputy Director at Breakthrough Missions, supporting others on the same path he once walked. Under the Halfway Service Model (HSM), Freddy and his team provide supervisees with a structured and supportive environment. From daily counselling sessions and chapel services to skills training and reintegration programmes, every step is designed to help them rebuild from the inside out. Beyond programmes, what truly makes a difference is the community. Freddy believes in creating strong, healthy relationships that supervisees can rely on, so they are less likely to return to old habits or harmful influences. Through shared experiences and unwavering support, Freddy and the team at Breakthrough Missions are helping supervisees rediscover purpose, resilience, and hope. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

On 12 June, our Volunteer Case Officers (VCOs) embarked on a learning journey to Institution B4 to gain a deeper insight into the incarceration experiencewhat it means, how it feels, and how it shapes the lives of those they support. By observing rehabilitation in action at the Correctional Unit, which includes the Hope Caf, the volunteers gained fresh perspective and reflected on how they can foster stronger, more meaningful connections with their supervisees. BeyondPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances BehindPrisonWalls SPSVCOSPSVolunteers HTVolunteers

Our CaptainsOfLives took on with courage in their hearts and fire in their stride. They showed up with conviction, pushed hard, proved what it means to rise to the challenge and cared for each other. Congratulations to our women's team for clinching first place in the Women Corporate Relay 40+ category with a time of 01:36:43. A proud moment for everyone who gave their all. Congratulations to the Singapore Prisons Emergency Action Response (SPEAR) Force team for flying the Singapore flag proudly at the recent 2025 Mock Prison Riot in Moundsville, West Virginia, USA.The SPEAR Force participants had secured several titles, including: First place in Hostage Rescue and Team Obstacle Course Second place in Recover, Breach and Secure For the first time in Mock Prison Riot history, SPS's SPEAR Force Operators also attained the first to fifth positions in the Super Swat Cop (Individual) category. Congratulations to our CaptainsOfLives for the outstanding achievements! SPS SingaporePrisonService SPEARForce BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances MockPrisonRiot

"Without you, I wouldn't have known what it means to be a father."This Father's Day, incarcerated fathers were reminded of the role they still play and the love that still exists. During a special session by the Centre for Fathering and the Singapore Prison Service, they received handwritten cards and heartfelt video messages from their children. Some haven't heard from their kids in years. Fathers then penned letters in return, filled with honesty, hope and love. It was a small step, but one that helps bridge the gap of absence. Love doesn't stop behind bars. Sometimes, it just needs help finding its way through. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances fathersday fathersday2025

That's a wrap for the inaugural TM Challenge! The TM Challenge on 30 May 2025 gathered our CaptainsOfLives from Institution TM1 and Selarang Park Complex for a team-based tactical readiness competition, where they put their skills, teamwork and operational preparedness to the test. Throughout the 1-day event, participants tackled realistic scenarios, such as riot response and medical emergency drills, each segment a simulation of the evolving demands of working in a correctional environment. Well done to all participants for their strong showing and congratulations to the top performers! CaptainsOfLives SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls

The TM Challenge on 30 May 2025 gathered our CaptainsOfLives from Institution TM1 and Selarang Park Complex for a team-based tactical readiness competition, where they put their skills, teamwork and operational preparedness to the test. Throughout the 1-day event, participants tackled realistic scenarios, such as riot response and medical emergency drills, each segment a simulation of the evolving demands of working in a correctional environment. Well done to all participants for their strong showing and congratulations to the top performers! CaptainsOfLives SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls

In the lead-up to the Yellow Ribbon Community Arts Festival (YRCAF) 2025, inmate artists were given a meaningful opportunity to show their artwork, which will be featured at the Festival, to their families. Organised by the YRCAF Committee and the , the Family Joint Session was more than just a visitit was a moment to reflect, create, and heal. Along with their families, they viewed artworks together, designed keepsakes, and reflected on how far their loved ones have come. Come experience these powerful stories for yourself this August at YRCAF: Static Exhibition @ One Holland Village (26 Aug) Roving Art Truck, islandwide (231 Aug)Let's celebrate creativity that inspires change. BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonProject YellowRibbonCommunityArtsFestival

[Update] Due to overwhelming response, registration has closed for the SPS Heritage Gallery Visits. Thank you for your interest! Ever wondered how Singapore's correctional landscape has evolved over the decades? Step into the SPS Heritage Gallery Open House and explore the rich history and transformation of the Singapore Prison Service from its early days as a custodial agency, to a correctional institution that also focuses on rehabilitation and reintegration. Learn how SPS continues to ensure the safe and secure custody of inmates, while supporting their journey toward reintegration and preventing re-offending. Limited slots are available sign up now via the QR code! SingaporePrisonService SPSHeritageGallery CaptainsOfLives Rehabilitation SingaporeHistory SPSHistory PrisonHistory Gallery ThingstodoinSG SGevents

Presenting to you our newest CaptainsOfLives! Congratulations to Cohorts 01/2024 & 02/2024 on successfully completing their Prison Officer Course training at the Singapore Prison Training Institute.Commissioner of Prisons, Ms Shie Yong Lee, officiated the Graduation Ceremony, that was attended by families and loved ones of the graduating trainees. These dedicated officers are now ready to take on the mantle of CaptainsOfLives and continue to uphold SPS's vision and values.We look forward to the positive impact they will make one life at a time. Joining the Singapore Prison Service wasn't something SGT Liv Rianty ever imagined. But four years on, she has found purpose in a place she least expected: building lives, supporting officers, and being part of a mission greater than herself. In her role as a Staff Development Officer at Cluster C, SGT Liv takes pride in her role which includes welcoming new officers, managing staff matters and fostering a positive work environment. Her experiences on the frontline, including a deployment to the Quarantine Centre during COVID-19, have shaped her perspective on resilience, teamwork, and growth. "What I love most? Meeting people from different walks of life and learning from their stories. It reminded me of why I chose this path."This is her story as a CaptainsOfLives, what will yours be?Looking for a meaningful career that challenges and transforms you? This could be it. Read more at SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances PrisJoinUs Careers WhatsYourStory

The inaugural Evidence-Informed Drug Rehabilitation and Prevention (ERP) Workshop held from 14 to 16 May 2025 brought together correctional professionals from over 14 jurisdictions around the world for meaningful collaboration and rich knowledge sharing. SPS shared our evidence-informed approach to drug rehabilitationcovering psychology-based interventions, risk and needs assessments, and the vital role of community partnerships in supporting reintegration. Participants also joined the Asia-Pacific Forum Against Drugs (APFAD) and attended .drugfreesgs Drug Victims Remembrance Day, where we remember the victims of drugs by creating awareness of how family and society, apart from the abusers, are harmed by drugs.Engaging discussions with our international counterparts sparked valuable exchanges of ideas and best practices. Together, were strengthening global efforts in drug rehabilitation and prevention. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

The inaugural Evidence-Informed Drug Rehabilitation and Prevention (ERP) Workshop held from 14 to 16 May 2025 brought together correctional professionals from over 14 jurisdictions around the world for meaningful collaboration and rich knowledge sharing. SPS shared our evidence-informed approach to drug rehabilitationcovering psychology-based interventions, risk and needs assessments, and the vital role of community partnerships in supporting reintegration. Participants also joined the Asia-Pacific Forum Against Drugs (APFAD) and attended .drugfreesgs Drug Victims Remembrance Day, where we remember the victims of drugs by creating awareness of how family and society, apart from the abusers, are harmed by drugs.Engaging discussions with our international counterparts sparked valuable exchanges of ideas and best practices. Together, were strengthening global efforts in drug rehabilitation and prevention. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

"My motivation to work with supervisees stems from a heartfelt belief that every second chance is a new beginning in each individual's journey." Meet Gina Chua, a Case Manager at Selarang Halfway House (SHWH), who works closely with SPS to adopt a co-case management approach that ensures that SHWH's residents have a safe and supportive environment, facilitating their reintegration into the community. Since the implementation of the Halfway House Model (HSM) and the enhanced Halfway House Model (HSM+), Gina and her other Case Manager colleagues provided enhanced support for all residents and their support networks, monitoring their progress and well-being even after they have left SHWH. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

At the Family and Community Day on 21 April 2025, inmates from the Psychiatric Correctional Unit (PCU) reconnected with loved ones, highlighting the importance of family in rehabilitation. The PCU, supported by .singapore professionals, provides mental health care, psychoeducation and therapy to aid recovery. SPS officers are trained to manage PCU inmates' behaviours with empathy, ensuring a safe and supportive environment for the inmates under their care. Since 2018, PCU's Family and Community Day has helped inmates strengthen family ties and help prepare them for reintegration. Families also learnt about post-release support that is available, while inmates shared their rehabilitation journeys. Through collaboration, care and commitment, we continue to support the well-being of inmates at the PCU, paving the way for second chances and brighter futures. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Strengthening regional ties through knowledge exchange and innovation. Recently, the Singapore Prison Service (SPS) hosted a delegation from the Korea Correctional Service (KCS), led by Vice Commissioner General Mr Kim Moon Tae, who were keen to find out more about SPS's approach towards correctional technology and rehabilitation. As part of their visit, the delegation from KCS visited the Singapore Prisons Emergency Action Response (SPEAR) Base and experienced tactical demonstrations conducted by our SPEAR Force Operators. SPS also showcased our prison initiativessuch as the Digital Rehabilitation and Individualised Corrections Tool (DIRECT) tablet and the Prison Automated Screening System (PASS). SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances CaptainsOfLives

With a firm belief in SPS's mission and its unique role to keep Singapore safe, ASP Gan Zi Xing contributes, in his own way, through strategic planning, international partnerships, and a passion for changing lives. Through his stint as a frontline Prison Officer in the Correctional Unit and his current role in fostering international relations, ASP Zi Xing believes in the power of teamwork, trust, and transformation working closely with fellow SPS officers to create a secure and supportive environment where inmates can rebuild their lives. Driving Innovation, Owning Innovation! On 27 March 2025, 11 teams of CaptainsOfLives showcased their creative AI-driven ideas at the Finals of the iDare Make-A-Pitch AIdeathon 2025. Congratulations to Team FIFA for securing first place with Digital Photo Submission with AI Moderationan efficient system that streamlines photo screening, supports families, and frees up staff for critical tasks! Team CEMS placed second for their Community-Based Programmes (CBP) Emplacement Management System (CEMS), an automated solution ensuring accurate and efficient CBP data consolidation. Team Innova took the third place with Clear & Earn Hours Automation, streamlining work hour management, while enhancing transparency and accountability.But the real win? The passion and innovation displayed by every SPS staff who stepped up to find innovative ways and leverage technology to simplify work processes, so that they may focus on higher order work! A huge thank you to our esteemed judgesMr Ng Pan Yong, Chief Innovation Officer, ; SAC Rockey Francisco Junior, Deputy Commissioner (Policy & Transformation); and DAC Patricia Tung, Director (Strategic Planning Division)! SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances BehindPrisonWalls idare2025

Congratulations to Team FIFA for securing first place with Digital Photo Submission with AI Moderationan efficient system that streamlines photo screening, supports families, and frees up staff for critical tasks! Team CEMS placed second for their Community-Based Programmes (CBP) Emplacement Management System (CEMS), an automated solution ensuring accurate and efficient CBP data consolidation. Team Innova took the third place with Clear & Earn Hours Automation, streamlining work hour management, while enhancing transparency and accountability.But the real win? The passion and innovation displayed by every SPS staff who stepped up to find innovative ways and leverage technology to simplify work processes, so that they may focus on higher order work! A huge thank you to our esteemed judgesMr Ng Pan Yong, Chief Innovation Officer, ; SAC Rockey Francisco Junior, Deputy Commissioner (Policy & Transformation); and DAC Patricia Tung, Director (Strategic Planning Division)! SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances BehindPrisonWalls idare2025

lovewins youareenoughThis March 8th, International Womens Day, I was invited to speak at Changi Female Prison. I brought my mum, making her dream come trueto return not as a prisoner, but as a beacon of hope. Mum was incarcerated in Changi from the mid-70s to 1983 for drug offenses. She turned her life around, living drug-free for decades. Her presence that day was a powerful message: *Its never too late to change. You are enough.* The inmates asked raw, valid questions about change and forgiveness. Mums life was the answerproof that no matter how far you fall, you can rise again. This day also reminded me of my familys 30-year journey to reconciliation. My parents divorced, and Dad remarried, but by Gods grace and effort, weve built a close-knit family. I adore my step-siblings, Adam and Andrea, and cherish the love we share. Ive been blessed with an incredible support systemmy overprotective brother, Spencer, who stepped up as a parent, my amazing aunties, uncles, and my Granny, who taught me, *Nothing is impossible, and family is worth fighting for.* To the ladies at Changi: Keep the faith. Believe in yourselves. Your past doesnt define your future. Never give up. And to anyone reading: Family and love are worth fighting for. Healing is possible. Grateful to AGAPE and Changi Prison for this meaningful opportunity. Forgiveness Reconciliation SecondChances Hope Family NeverGiveUp LoveWins

As we celebrate International Womens Day, we recognise the resilience and dedication of women in OneHomeTeam. CaptainOfLives AC Karen Lee, Director of SPS's Rehabilitation & Reintegration Division, joined other women leaders at HQ, sharing insights on their roles, leadership, and transformation in public service.AC Karen also shared about her personal journey in servicethe challenges she has faced and how she is grateful to have had supportive bosses, as well as roles that empower her, while providing the flexibility to balance career and family.Her experiences in corrections and rehabilitation show that women in public service can excel as leaders and make a meaningful impact in their fields. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances IWD2025

WhatIf prison inmates decided to stage a riot during yard time? On 5 February 2025, officers at Institution B4 carried out a Planned Contingency Exercise to sharpen their operational readiness. As part of the exercise, officers responded to a simulated riot in the yard, testing their crisis management skills and coordination with other teams. Working alongside the Singapore Prisons Emergency Action Response (SPEAR) team, the response was swift and effective. Regular exercises like these strengthen teamwork within SPS, allowing officers to refine joint tactics, enhance communication, and stay prepared to handle any situation with precision. CaptainsOfLives SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls

WhatIf prison inmates decided to stage a riot during yard time? On 5 February 2025, officers at Institution B4 carried out a Planned Contingency Exercise to sharpen their operational readiness. As part of the exercise, officers responded to a simulated riot in the yard, testing their crisis management skills and coordination with other teams. Working alongside the Singapore Prisons Emergency Action Response (SPEAR) team, the response was swift and effective. Regular exercises like these strengthen teamwork within SPS, allowing officers to refine joint tactics, enhance communication, and stay prepared to handle any situation with precision. In 2024, the Singapore Prison Service (SPS) continues to fulfil our mission of enforcing the secure custody of inmates and rehabilitating them, for a safer Singapore. There were no escapes from custody and assault rates remained low and stable compared to other jurisdictions. There has been more success in helping offenders desist from crime, with the overall recidivism rate dropping as compared to the previous year. By partnering with the , employers, volunteers, and community partners, SPS will continue its efforts to keep recidivism low and stable, promoting long-term desistance from crime and drugs.BeyondSecondChances BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

From 5 to 7 November 2024, SPS hosted the Home Team C.A.R.E Course (HTCC) for 130 participants from various agencies under the .The HTCC aimed to equip participants with basic skills and knowledge required to render psychological first aid as C.A.R.E officers during times of crisis or disasters.The three-day course was an opportunity for officers to come together, learn from each other, and improve their approaches in providing direct support for staff and their family members when the need arises. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls OneHomeTeam MHA

Beyond rehabilitating inmates and supporting their families, a lot of work is done behind-the-scenes to ensure that rehabilitation programmes are conducted smoothly, and support is promptly provided to the families of inmates.Meet Unsung Hero DSP Lee Hong Jie, a Staff Officer (Rehabilitation Services and Delivery) from SPS's Rehabilitation & Reintegration Division!Other than ensuring that resources to conduct rehabilitation programmes in the prisons are procured, DSP Hong Jie's team also collaborates with community partners to set up support services for inmates and their families within the community.Find out more about what he does, and how he feels about making an impact on the community at large.Show him some appreciation in the comments below!BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

Breaking Records Through Giving Back As part of the National Youth Achievement Award (NYAA) Programme, which focused on the rehabilitation of youth inmates through leadership, service, and personal growth, 20 Gold Award inmate participants collaborated with to create a life-sized 3.6m x 3.6m Monopoly board for Jenaris Home at Pelangi Village. Designed to foster cognitive stimulation and social interaction for its residents, this project earned a spot in the Singapore Book of Records as the largest Monopoly board game, demonstrating the potential of giving back to the community. SPS SG4SecondChances BehindPrisonWalls

For MX Megan Wee, it takes passion and dedication to carry out effective reformative training.The nature of her work centres around people - on one hand, motivating and helping inmates to turn their life around for the better; on the other, working closely with her colleagues to elevate intervention techniques. If you're person-centric like MX Megan, perhaps you would be a good fit as a Correctional Rehabilitation Specialist with SPS. Celebrating Growth, Resilience & Positivity At the National Youth Achievement Awards (NYAA) Ceremony 2024, SPS celebrated the achievements of 94 young inmates who completed the programme, with 66 earning Gold.Guest-of-Honour, Mr .sg , Senior Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Social and Family Development and Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth, praised the inmates efforts, emphasising the transformative impact of positivity and kindness. He also encouraged them to leverage their NYAA experiences to rebuild relationships and lead meaningful lives after release. SPS SG4SecondChances BehindPrisonWalls

A heartfelt Thank You to all Yellow Ribbon Community Project (YRCP) volunteers for their dedication towards supporting the families of offenders. Since 2010, the YRCP and its grassroots volunteers have provided pro-social support to the families of inmates, helping to stabilise their homes from the effects of incarceration, so inmates can focus on their rehabilitation. This year, 28 grassroots divisions and 292 individuals received long service awards at the YRCP Awards and Appreciation Luncheon 2024 on 16 November.A special thank you to Guest-of-Honour, Mr , Minister for Transport and Second Minister for Finance, and Assoc Prof Muhammad, Minister of State, Ministry of Home Affairs and Minister of National Development, for their presence and steadfast support. BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChance SGVolunteers VolunteerImpact SPS SingaporePrisonService

On 1 November 2024, SSGT Mansur Zainal, a Reception Operations Officer from the SPS's Ops Division, received 's Community First Responder Award for aiding an injured motorist during a road traffic accident that happened on 7 October 2024.Together with a former prison officer, his wife and an off-duty SCDF officer, SSGT Mansur worked alongside them to ensure the safety of the injured motorist and administer first aid. "I then used my whistle to slow down traffic and direct cars away from the scene," said the former Traffic Police turned CaptainOfLives. "With support from an off-duty SCDF officer and members of the public, the situation was brought under control. I left the scene knowing I had done what I could to help, and I remain grateful for the kindness of others who assisted." Photo Credit: SCDF SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances SCDF OneHomeTeam CommunityLifesavers

Keep calm and carry on. Last month, SPS organised a get-together for other CaptainsOfLives to unwind and bond through specially curated wellness activities as part of World Mental Health Day. The short disconnect from work helps improve the mental wellness of staff, reminding them of the importance of mental wellness, and sharing some tips and tricks to maintain their mental resilience. Before our staff can be empowered to look after others, they must first learn, and be reminded to look after themselves. What would you do to disconnect from work? Share your tips and pointers with us in the comments below. SPS SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances WorldMentalHealthDay

Not if, but when! SPS conducts frequent exercises to enhance its protocols in responding to all types of emergencies that may occur within prisons. Recently, we collaborated with the to sharpen our approach in managing viral outbreaks, such as Mpox, to ensure that cleaning, disinfection and quarantine procedures are conducted smoothly. CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

When gardening is not just about plants its about people coming together for a shared purpose.Using recycled materials, our resourceful CaptainsOfLives from Selarang Park Complex started a community garden on 19 May 2023 to grow edible plants and fruit trees for staff to enjoy.The SPC Community Garden entered the Singapore Gardeners Cup during the Singapore Garden Festival to showcase the horticultural talents of its community gardeners, where they won the Best of Show and Gold awards! SPS SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChance

SPS was honoured to host the Stanford LEAD Innovation Tour 2024, with 31 participants from all around the globe gathered to learn about our approach to corrections, the Yellow Ribbon Project and our transformation journey. The participants visited SPS's correctional facilities, where they gleaned rare insights on SPS and 's policies and initiatives that aimed to foster safer and more inclusive communities through innovative practices.SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances BeyondPrisonWalls

Learning from the best, with the best. From August to September, SPSs SPEAR Force hosted officers from the Hong Kong Correctional Service Departments Regional Response Team for joint training sessions. Both departments fostered a strong working relationship and best practices in training methods and perspectives were exchanged. Heres to more opportunities to gain valuable insight from overseas counterparts! BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

We're continuing on with our trip down memory lane for the Community Corrections Command (COMC) 10th Anniversary! From 2014 to 2019, SPS continued to develop its capabilities in community corrections, including the formation of COMC, setting up of the Community and Rehabilitation Centre (CRC), and the launch of Selarang Park Complex (SPC).Keep your eyes peeled for more s coming your way!BeyondPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances COMC

We're excited to celebrate the remarkable achievements of our CaptainsOfLives at the Home Team Training Excellence Award 2024! 1 ASP Wong Tian Lee from the Singapore Prison Training Institute was presented with the Merit Trainer Award for her dedication to elevating the standards of training.2 SGT Muhammed Farhan bin Mohd Salleh from SPEAR Force was recognised for championing the Blended Learning approach and enhancing trainee development. 3 A big shout out to the Community Corrections Command team, who received the Special Commendation Award for their impactful work in Correctional Case Management training. Congratulations to all award recipients for their tireless efforts in shaping the future of rehabilitation. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

What is THE GAME PLAN?Swipe to find out how SPS increases Reformative Trainees' (RTs) motivation to change and encourage positive behaviours while they are released on supervision by gamifying community supervision! In The Game Plan, RTs could earn points by completing milestones such as attending self-help programmes or participating in community service. They could then use these points to redeem privileges such as an extension of curfew hours. This incentivises them to remain offence free and take greater ownership of their reintegration journey. SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances BeyondPrisonWalls

It is the duty of CaptainsOfLives to ensure the safe custody and facilitate the rehabilitation of inmates. But who takes care of them? Meet a pair of Unsung Heroes, DSP Lin Zhiye, OC (Well-being) from the Staff Development Division (SDD) and HTS Chua Hong Lin, a Psychologist from the Psychological and Correctional Rehabilitation Division (PCRD)!In their own roles, they work tirelessly to provide a safe space for Captains of Lives to share their challenges for their mental wellness and implement well-being programmes to ensure officer well-being. Their jobs require empathy and a strong desire to make a difference. Read about how they do what they do, and what it all means to them. Show them some love in the comments below too!BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

We've come a long way since the formation of Community Corrections Command (COMC) in 2014! DidYouKnow that even before 2014, the concept of Community Corrections was already in place in Singapore? It all started with the introduction of the Work Release Scheme in 1985! It has been many meaningful years of supporting supervisees in their gradual reintegration in the community. Stay tuned for more s on other memorable milestones coming your way as we celebrate COMC's 10th anniversary this year!BeyondPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances COMC

It's a wrap for the first-ever Tactical Readiness 360 Competition organised by Cluster A! On 24 July 2024, our CaptainsOfLives from various Clusters and Commands went head-to-head against each other, pitting their competencies for contingency preparedness and tactical skills to the test. Working in teams of five, they worked together to overcome intense challenges that required quick thinking and sharp responses, as they navigated through various high-pressure scenarios. A big shoutout to the participants who demonstrated what it means to be operationally ready, and congratulations to the winners! BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

The Yellow Ribbon Project is honoured to have received the Presidents Award at the International Corrections & Prisons Association (ICPA) Correctional Excellence Awards Ceremony during the ICPA Annual Conference 2024!Over the past twenty years, we have made remarkable progress in championing second chances for inmates and ex-offenders. Heres to many more years of garnering support for second chances, towards a more inclusive Singapore. ICPA2024 EnablingDesistance BeyondRecidivism SecondChances YellowRibbonProject BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonProject YRP20
[Yellow Ribbon Prison Run 2024]

Celebrating 20 years of Second Chances together at the International Corrections & Prisons Association (ICPA) Annual Conference 2024! On 4 September 2024, Yellow Ribbon Community Day was launched as part of Regional Day at ICPA Annual Conference 2024. After an opening address by Chief Justice of Singapore, Sundaresh Menon, ICPA delegates and community partners shared their experiences during various plenary sessions and workshops.The comprehensive sharing underscores how efforts by SPS and other CARE Network partners provide crucial support to offenders towards successful desistance. As part of the celebrations, the Yellow Ribbon Project also launched part two of the web publication, "Celebrating Second Chances", which showcases stories from the community, highlighting their journeys and showcasing the resilience and hope that comes with second chances! A huge thank you to everyone for your continued support in supporting the rehabilitation and reintegration of inmates and ex-offenders. Check out both parts of the 20th-anniversary web publication here:Part 1: Part 2: SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls ICPA2024 EnablingDesistance BeyondRecidivism CaptainsOfLives SecondChances YellowRibbonProject BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonProject YRP20

As part of the celebrations, the Yellow Ribbon Project also launched part two of the web publication, "Celebrating Second Chances", which showcases stories from the community, highlighting their journeys and showcasing the resilience and hope that comes with second chances! A huge thank you to everyone for your continued support in supporting the rehabilitation and reintegration of inmates and ex-offenders. Check out both parts of the 20th-anniversary web publication here:Part 1: Part 2: SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls ICPA2024 EnablingDesistance BeyondRecidivism CaptainsOfLives SecondChances YellowRibbonProject BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonProject YRP20

The annual International Corrections & Prisons Association (ICPA) Annual Conference 2024 has begun! Guest-Of-Honour, Minister for Digital Development and Information & Second Minister for Home Affairs, Mrs .ylm , launched the conference with a speech that welcomed the international delegates and reiterated the importance of corrections within the criminal justice system. From 1 to 6 September 2024, SPS will host correctional leaders from around the world as they gather in Singapore to foster networking and collaboration, while engaging each other to share best practices and learn from one another, to advance the standards of corrections.Themed Enabling Desistance: Beyond Recidivism, more than 800 corrections practitioners from over 70 jurisdictions will participate in this years conference.Throughout the week, conference participants will participate in plenary sessions, workshops, visits to correctional facilities and various networking events.SPS is honoured to have the opportunity to showcase Singapores model of corrections and the exemplary standard of Captains of Lives and community partners. CaptainsOfLives BeyondPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService ICPA2024 EnablingDesistance BeyondRecidivism

SPS welcomed more than 100 international participants who joined us for this year's Yellow Ribbon Prison Run (YRPR)! They are in Singapore for the International Corrections and Prisons Association (ICPA) Annual Conference 2024, hosted by SPS, happening from 1 to 6 September 2024. The participants demonstrated their commitment towards this years ICPA Annual Conference theme - "Enabling Desistance: Beyond Recidivism" by participating in the YRPR and raising awareness towards giving inmates and ex-offenders a second chance in life! Stay tuned over the next few days as we share more exciting updates on ICPA Annual Conference 2024. Since its inception in 2009, the Gang Renunciation Programme (GRP) has helped inmates renounced their gangs affiliations, rebuild family relations, and develop a pro-social lifestyle. As part of the programme, inmates attended a Gang Renunciation Ceremony, where they formally renounce their gang affiliations, in front of their loved ones, counsellors, and prison staff.To date, over 1,600 inmates have successfully renounced from their gangs. CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances SPS SingaporePrisonService

Stronger Together, Rebuilding Lives On August 2, 2024, we celebrated our dedicated prison volunteers and community partners for their invaluable support in SPS's rehabilitation and reintegration efforts. Since 2007, the SPS Volunteer Awards Ceremony has honoured those who contributed selflessly towards rehabilitating inmates and reintegrating ex-offenders.This year, we recognised volunteers with long service awards, appreciation plaques, 10 years' Journey Shields, and the Throughcare Hero Award, a new award that was launched in 2023. At the ceremony, Guest of Honour Associate Professor emphasised the crucial role that SPS volunteers play in supporting ex-offenders beyond prison walls, helping them commit to change and build new pro-social networks. With over 4,200 volunteers from over 60 organisations, our volunteers are crucial pillars that provide emotional support, share their knowledge and guide inmates to stay focused on their rehabilitation. If you're inspired to join us as an SPS volunteer, visit to see how you can make a difference.VolunteerAwardsCeremony BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChance

On 28 July 2024, DSP Simon Lee, Assistant Manager, Correctional Rehabilitation Services from SPS's Community Corrections Command and two Reformative Trainees shaved their heads to support 's Hair For Hope campaign, which raises awareness for childhood cancer. "I work with Reformative Trainees released on community supervision in their rehabilitation and reintegration journey. By participating in this year's Hair For Hope, it was an opportunity for them to build empathy for others", shared DSP Simon Lee.Send them your support in the comments below! Stronger, Together! SPS's first-ever Strongman Challenge, hosted by three official judges, saw 60 CaptainsOfLives showcase their incredible power and camaraderie. From pulling vehicles to mastering the Sandbag Toss, our teams crushed it! Congratulations to Avengers (from Cluster A), SGT Mohammad Khairil Saad, and RO Brenna Sim for their top finishes! We can't wait for the next iteration of the Strongman Challenge!SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Officers from SPS and gathered for a series of exercises in July 2024, including a Ground Deployment Exercise and a Tabletop Exercise, held within the Changi Prison Complex.The sessions allowed participants from both Home Team Departments with the opportunity to test their responses to various scenario-based operations and contingencies.Through these exercises, SPS and SPF were able to refine their responses to joint operations in safeguarding Singapore's safety and security. Their participation symbolises the inmates' resolve to give back to the community, as well as their commitment towards highlighting the spirit of inclusivity and how anyone can support the Hair For Hope campaign, regardless of their circumstances.BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService HairForHope MakeABaldStatement

Empowering growth, for inmates and Captains of Lives. Meet RO Daniel Ng, who was recently appointed as a Staff Officer in SPS's Staff Development Division as part of SPS's job rotation arrangement for Uniformed Officers. Fresh from his previous role as a Senior Correction Unit Officer, Daniel shared his journey as a CaptainOfLives as he transitions from equipping inmates with the skills that they need to reintegrate into society, to supporting fellow Prison Officers. Read his story to learn more about what inspires him to work at SPS and his hopes for personal growth as a responsible individual. BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonServiceSG4SecondChances CaptainsOfLives PrisJoinUs Careers SPSScholars

SPS's Self-Help and Rehabilitation E-application (SHARE) mobile application, which was created by Activate Interactive, won the Singapore Digital Initiative Of The Year Correctional Services awards at the GovMedia Conference & Awards 2024. The SHARE app is designed to encourage ex-offenders to take greater ownership of their rehabilitation journey by giving them easier access to resources and other helpful tools. It also streamlines processes and brings forth organisational efficiency. This allows Reintegration Officers from SPS to dedicate more time to supervision and counselling.We appreciate GovMedia's recognition of our innovation efforts in the correctional services space, to help ex-offenders turn their lives around.CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

The 2024 Short-Term Immersion Programme (STIP) organised by SPS brought together key government agencies and statutory boards for two days of valuable cross-learning on service excellence. This year, participants from MOE, PSD, HDB, MUIS, Sentosa, IRAS, MOM, and MSF visited various prison facilities, including Prison Link Centre Changi, where they learnt how SPS upholds service excellence in its engagement with stakeholders and beneficiaries.This year's STIP fostered incredible synergy among those present, with participants offering valuable insights and perspectives from their own agencies that bolstered our collective efforts to further enhance service delivery standards within Singapore. SPS will continue to share our knowledge and experience to drive service excellence across all organisations. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls

There wasn't a dry eye in the room. Share the heartwarming moments from the annual Family & Community Day at the Singapore Prison Service Psychiatric Correctional Unit (PCU). On this day, PCU inmates reconnected with their families and shared key milestones in their rehabilitation journey. It was also the first time women PCU inmates joined the event. With professional support from the .singapore, various community partners, and dedicated CaptainsOfLives, SPS continues to build bridges for inmates and their families, paving the way for rehabilitation and reintegration. The session also equipped families with the resources and tools to support their loved ones' journeys. SPS SingaporePrisonService BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls sg4secondchances

Find out how inmates from the Assisted Living Correctional Unit (ALCU) benefit from the exercise therapy, facilitated by (CCS) and (TSA). The exercise physiologist from CCS and volunteers from both agencies conduct monthly sessions for inmates who are elderly or physically disabled with mobility issues, helping them stretch their muscles, thereby improving their physical, mental, and psychological well-being. Through such initiatives, SPS hopes to increase the inmates sense of connectedness with the community and better prepare them for their eventual reintegration into society. Reintegration journeys can be tough, but they don't need to be undertaken alone. Since its inception in April 2023, the Desistor Network (DN) has established a community for ex-offenders. Together with the Singapore Prison Service and other community partners, the DN provides valuable resources for ex-offenders through community support, mentorship, and more.As we enter 2024, the mission remains unwavering: to empower desistors to thrive and contribute meaningfully to society. Through networking sessions, skill-building training, and an ever-expanding list of support initiatives, the DN will continue to aid ex-offenders towards successful reintegration into the community after their release.Join us in celebrating the DN's first anniversary, and share your words of encouragement in the comments below! SPS SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls sg4secondchances desistornetwork ISCOS

Stepping into the Future with Corrections 2030. The SPS-YRSG Corporate Advance 2024, themed Forward Corrections: Beyond Second Chances, was held on 30 April 2024 at the Singapore EXPO. This years annual seminar saw about 600 SPS and staff and strategic partners come together to share future plans for the next bound of transformation in corrections. Guest-of-Honour, Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law, Mr K Shanmugam, commended SPSs relentless efforts towards rehabilitation and reintegration, which have led to remarkable two-year and five-year recidivism rates. As we transition from Corrections 2025 to Corrections 2030, were charting new territories with: S.M.A.R.T. Prisons Uplifting and Strengthening inmates familiesMaximising the employability and career progression of inmates and ex-offenders Mobilising the Community Developing our CaptainsOfLives Together, we will continue to work towards a safer, and more inclusive Singapore. CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls sg4secondchances

Now, as a guiding force in reintegration, Illamaran continues to help others to rehab, renew and restart. RO Charlvi Tan, Officer-in-Charge of Institution TM1 and TM2 Control Centre, is instrumental in ensuring the security of Tanah Merah Institution.Starting as a Warder and steadily progressing through the ranks to reach the position of Rehabilitation Officer, RO Charlvi's journey reflects his unwavering determination and passion for his work within the Singapore Prison Service (SPS).Over his 33-year-long career, he has gained extensive experience and has also seized the opportunity to further his education with SPS. His steadfast dedication to ensuring the security and rehabilitation of inmates at Institution TM1 and TM2 exemplifies the core values of SPS and serves as an inspiration to his colleagues and peers.CaptainOfLives BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances PrisJoinUs Careers

In SPS, we encourage innovation and experimentation to improve work processes! On 21 March 2024, 13 teams of CaptainsOfLives presented their innovative solutions to enhance work processes at the finals of SPS's iDare Make-A-Pitch 2024! Congratulations to Team Cluster B Corporate Services (BCS) for their ground-breaking solution, F.A.S.T (Food Aperture Sliding Type), and for clinching first place. In second place was Team Choice Architects with their project, The Game Plan, where they proposed a way to empower ROS supervisees in their rehabilitation journey by gamifying tasks and achievements!Third place was won by Team Dare To Soar, who proposed a way to minimise unlocking of inmates during external movements by redesigning attire worn by inmates one with velco straps!No matter the winner, every presentation highlighted the dedication of our officers every finalist signified a win for SPS overall. And a big thank you to our judges, Mr Christopher Goh, Specialist (Experience Design), Singapore Polytechnic, SAC Rockey Francisco Junior, Deputy Commissioner (Policy & Transformation), and DAC Patricia Tung, Director (Strategic Planning Division)! BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService idare2024

The first joint operation between SPS and at the purpose-built Quarantine Centre in Selarang Park Complex on 22 February 2024 marked a significant step in deeper cooperation between both agencies. The operation aimed to enhance the operation preparedness and response capabilities in handling potential disease outbreaks within SPS, while also validating the effectiveness of Whole-of-Government joint efforts and cooperation, as demonstrated with NEA.Exercises like these also help to ensure that SPS remains well-equipped to handle future pandemic situations.BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService NEA

Embracing self-care at SPS Wellness Festival 2024! Life gets busy, but its important we make time to check in with ourselves. The SPS Wellness Festival promotes mental wellness and resilience among SPS staff by engaging in new ways to relax and rejuvenate.In order for us to show up for others, heres a timely reminder to also show up for ourselves! This year, we learnt how to tackle burnout, enjoyed new activities together, and prioritised our well-being as Captains of Lives (COLs). Cultivating a culture of support, we also encouraged our COLs to seek support from those around us when needed.Comment below and tell us your favourite ways to relax and recharge!BeyondPrisonWalls SPSCareers PrisJoinUs SG4SecondChances CaptainsOfLives

What comes to mind when you think of the word 'masculinity'? Cast aside whatever preconceived notions you had, like the participants at the "Breaking Stereotypes: Celebrating Positive Masculinity" Symposium, hosted by .THK invited Singapore Prison Service PCRD to be part of this conversation on domestic violence, as we shed some light on the available programmes and services to help this population.Through these initiatives, we work closely with our community partners in encouraging inmates and ex-offenders to seek support where needed, and be proactive in building healthy family relationships. Share your words of encouragement for them as they aim to build a life-giving cycle with their loved ones.SPS SingaporePrisonService BeyondPrisonWalls sg4secondchances

Are you often lost for words when putting pen to paper? Thats also a familiar struggle to Desmund Luo, who emerged as one of the top inmate students of his A-levels cohort. Although eloquent in person, Desmund found it challenging to articulate his thoughts in writing, especially for General Paper and Economics essays. Aided by the support and dedication of Prison School teachers like Ms Kelly Wang, Desmund crafted his own writing style and worked his way to obtaining stellar results. With his achievements, Desmund is eyeing further studies in Environmental Studies, and hopes that his journey can be an inspiration for anyone who aspires to make a positive change in society. Join us in congratulating Desmund and his fellow A-Level graduates, and leave your well wishes for them in the comments.SPS SingaporePrisonService Alevels Alevelresults BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances PrisonSchool

Inmates from Institution B1 celebrated the 3rd Anniversary of the Empatherapy Programme (ETP) on 22 February 2024. Started in 2021, the Empatherapy Programme, aims to foster a sense of community and understanding among inmates by having regular sessions where they are encouraged to express their thoughts and feelings. It also provided a space for Correctional Unit Officers to engage and support the inmates.The group of Empatherapy Peer Supporters in B1 has grown from a small number of participants 3 years ago to a group of 40 now, including those out in the community. With more inmates who were part of ETP released, a session was also held for them to gather once again and commemorate the occasion. Share your support for SPS staff, inmates and ex-offenders in the comments below. BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances

Why Searches Matter in Prisons In the Singapore Prison Service, our commitment to safety and inmate rehabilitation is unwavering.Regular searches are crucial to this process, helping us maintain a secure environment for both inmates and our dedicated Prison Officers, partners and volunteers.By meticulously conducting searches, we proactively identify and mitigate potential risks within the prison environment. This fosters an atmosphere where everyone in our prisons feels safe, and one where inmates can focus on their rehabilitation journey without distractions.BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances CaptainsOfLives

What does the first step to breaking barriers and achieving dreams look like? Through the support provided by SPS and his perseverance, he scored four distinctions and even attained an A1 for Mathematics! Hear from this year's National Youth Achievement Award (NYAA) Gold Award recipients, Ned and Fai (not their real names), as they share their reflections through this journey. Under the NYAA programme, they were able to develop themselves physically and mentally, as well as give back to the community. The 89 awardees made remarkable use of their time in the spirit of giving back by running within the prison compounds, raising $8,220 for the Yellow Ribbon Prison Run 2023 . They also designed festive cards for beneficiaries from Moral Welfare Home and Play.Able , among other initiatives that focused on contributing back to the community, even while serving their sentences.We congratulate the awardees of the NYAA programme and wish them the best in their rehabilitation and reintegration journey! SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances NYAA TransformationJourney

The 89 awardees made remarkable use of their time in the spirit of giving back by running within the prison compounds, raising $8,220 for the Yellow Ribbon Prison Run 2023 . They also designed festive cards for beneficiaries from Moral Welfare Home and Play.Able , among other initiatives that focused on contributing back to the community, even while serving their sentences.We congratulate the awardees of the NYAA programme and wish them the best in their rehabilitation and reintegration journey! SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances NYAA TransformationJourney

Congratulations to ASP Muhammad Sadiq Bin Saad and his team for bagging the Home Team Achievement Award! His team's relentless dedication to fortifying the support ecosystems for inmates and ex-offenders deserves all the applause. ASP Sadiq has actively collaborated with community partners, including Malay/Muslim organisations and , to drive initiatives that foster ex-offender reintegration. Recent partnerships with grassroots organisations have expanded volunteering opportunities available, sparking a virtuous cycle of giving back to the community. This award is a well-deserved acknowledgment of the team's hard work and serves as motivation for their impactful journey. Let's cheer on ASP Sadiq and his team for their unwavering commitment to positive change! CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Dive into the latest Prison News as we highlight the importance of community collaborations in supporting inmates and ex-offenders in their journey towards desistance. Explore the CARE Network Summit's insights on community collaboration, key to supporting inmates' journey towards desistance. Relive the remarkable return of the Yellow Ribbon Prison Run 2023, a symbol of hope beyond second chances. Celebrate excellence with MHA National Day Awardees, exemplifying dedication to rehabilitation and reintegration.Learn from experts like Professor Beth Weaver and Ms. Salina Samion on fostering desistance and sustaining support in Singapore's context. Explore the workings of the State Courts Lock-Up and the impactful role of over 2,500 diverse volunteers in inmates' rehabilitation.Read more at: BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances PrisonNews2023

"Embracing a Bright Future Introducing our newly minted Prison Officers! After successfully completing a rigorous 38-week (for Rehabilitation Officers) or 30-week (for Sergeants) training at the Singapore Prison Training Institute (SPTI), theyre now ready to make a difference behind and beyond the prison walls. We shine the spotlight on Cohort 02/2022s outstanding trainees, RO Yasmin Marican and SGT Syaiful Bahary, whose exceptional journey and achievements inspire us all. As the best trainees from this cohort, they dedicate their awards to a culmination of hard work, dedication, and commitment from all their batchmates. Join us in congratulating the entire graduating class of Cohort 2/2022. With their unwavering commitment, theyre set to create a brighter tomorrow for all. SPSGraduationNewBeginnings ExceptionalGraduates Inspiration SPS2023 SPSCohort2022 SPSGraduationNewBeginnings SPSLeadership Inspiration

As technology keeps developing, so do our CaptainsOfLives !Through courses and seminars, like the recent Robotic Process Automation (RPA) seminar on 11 October, we continually take steps to improve operations for a safe and secure prison, and upskill our staff .Leveraging on technology, such as RPA, allows SPS staff to rededicate time that would have been spent on menial matters, and focus on higher order work.SPS SingaporePrisonService

A Journey of Excellence On 31 October 2023, we honoured and celebrated the remarkable achievements of 14 dedicated Prison Officers from Cohort 2/2022. Upon completing the Rehabilitation Officer Conversion (ROC) Course at Singapore Prison Training Institute (SPTI), theyre now ready to take on higher responsibilities and inspire other COLs as future Senior Prison Officers. Hear from this years Merit Award recipient, ASP Goh Yan Xiu Goh, on his journey towards personal growth as a CaptainOfLives.The opportunity to progress from Prison Officers to Senior Prison Officers encourage our staff to pursue excellence their various duties in the field of corrections. Congratulations to our Merit Award recipients, together with all of Cohort 2/2022 ROC officers!Your dedication to personal growth and achieving this leadership milestone is commendable. SPSLeadership Inspiration Cohort2022 CaptainsOfLives PrisJoinUs

We were thrilled to host the Yellow Ribbon Community Project (YRCP) Appreciation and Awards Luncheon 2023 with Guest-Of-Honour, Mrs. Josephine Teo, Minister for Communications and Information and Second Minister for Home Affairs. On 4 November 2023, 20 awards were presented to dedicated divisions and over 400 individuals for their 3, 5, and 10-year commitment to the YRCP. Since its inception in 2010, all 93 grassroots divisions in Singapore are now part of the YRCP. Together with over 1,100 volunteers, YRCP has touched the lives of 21,000 families, providing community support in their hour of need! YRCP's exciting plans for the future include emphasising stronger community partnerships and expanded support for families both during incarceration and after release. Together, we're working to prevent the cycle of reoffending and provide lasting, meaningful support. Show our volunteers and partners some appreciation in the comments below! YRCPAAL2023 SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances

If we could remind our future selves of something, what would it be? Hear from Jamie (not his real name), who is a supervisee undergoing a community-based programme at Jamiyah Halfway house, and his letter to himself. Amidst his concerns and hopes for the future, support from family and acceptance from the community provide the foundation for supervisees, like Jamie, to reintegrate into society upon release. What do you think of Jamies resolve? Drop a to share your support towards second chances.CaptainsOfLives SPS SingaporePrisonService

Amidst his concerns and hopes for the future, support from family and acceptance from the community provide the foundation for supervisees, like Jamie, to reintegrate into society upon release. What do you think of Jamies resolve? Drop a to share your support towards second chances.CaptainsOfLives SPS SingaporePrisonService

Meet ASP Ponnarasi D/O Gopal Chandra from the Community Corrections Command - a true guardian of integrity within the Singapore Prison Service. In her role, she oversees supervisees as they take their first steps towards reintegrating into the community. ASP Ponnarasi's work has earned her the Efficiency Medal award at the MHA National Day Awards! In our ongoing commitment to uphold the highest standards, she shares insights and stories that exemplify the importance of integrity as a Captain of Lives. Most people think, just do, and get swept along by the current. We then stop taking care of ourselves. Ready for some sage advice? We sit down with Ms Rashida Mohamed Zain, Senior Assistant Director and Lead Psychologist from SPS's Psychological and Correctional Rehabilitation Division !Read all about the hard work she puts into developing the mental resilience of inmates and our Captains of Lives. No matter the challenges they face, Rashida and her team of professionals have got their back . Shes even got important advice for YOU too . Stay tuned for more Stories From Prison and show Rashida some appreciation in the comments below !SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances CaptainsOfLives

On 13 October 2023, the SPS Correctional Practice and Research Symposium 2023 took place at Suntec Convention Centre. Over 350 attendees from internal staff to external agencies came together to share efforts in promoting desistance and reducing the five-year recidivism rate. This was done through an engaging exchange of research knowledge and learnings between all. The Symposium hopes to: Increase organisational evidence-mindedness and best practices by SPS staff and local community partners, To engage with and encourage research collaboration with members of Correctional Science Research Network (CSRN)True to the spirit of this years theme: Transforming Connections; Strengthening Partnerships; the unwavering commitment of various stakeholders was clearly evident during the symposium. All were eager to learn, discuss, reflect and make beneficial changes in their respective roles. Show them some appreciation in the comments below with a ! BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Trying to solve a problem but finding yourself lost? It's a challenge that Correctional Unit Officer Muhammad Asraf is all too familiar with Find out how he created a network robot with zero programming experience. Through the Robotic Process Automation course, he and other CaptainsOfLives get hands-on with the latest tech to improve and automate their work processes, and enhance their capabilities! CaptainsOfLives SPS SingaporePrisonService

Here's your sign to pause, take a deep breath, keep calm and carry on. Self-reflection is a crucial part of an inmate's rehabilitation process to inspire growth.Take this piece of advice from Jason (not his real name). Jason is an inmate peer supporter who developed and designed the Empatherapy programme together with his team. He also provides emotional support to fellow inmates within his Correctional Unit.He also assists in the training of inmates to be Peer Supporters from other institutions at the Peer Supporter Academy.BehindPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances

"A book is a gift you can open again and again." Garrison Keillor Introducing the Read For Books initiative, where our Reformative Trainees came together to contribute back to society while serving their sentence! Working hand in hand with Wonderread and kidsREAD, 1 book was donated for every 10 inmates who read together for 15 mins. Swipe to find out more about this, and recommend us some of YOUR favourite books in the comments below! SPS SingaporePrisonService SG4SecondChances

In our work as a correctional agency, we process data daily, so there is potential to glean further insights to make informed decisions in our work as CaptainsOfLives. Introducing DATxPRISONS2023, part of the Data Arcade Tournament (DAT), an annual data and AI competition for public officers to practice and showcase their data storytelling skills. On 26 September 2023, some 39 likeminded staff from across the Singapore Prison Service gathered to tell their stories through Tableau's data visualisation platform. The participating teams used appropriate visualisation techniques (e.g. charts and graphs) for the data they were analysing which allowed them to identify key insights and trends in the data. They then combined this information into a dashboard that was clear and cohesive, making it easy for their fellow colleagues and judges to understand the data and appreciate the key takeaways from each chart. We met with three participants to find out what they have learnt in their data journey! DATxPRISONS2023 SPS SingaporePrisonService

The Singapore Prison Service (SPS) is proud to launch the Inaugural International Correctional Leadership Programme (ICLP), the first-of-its-kind in the Asia Pacific region where leaders of the international correctional agencies gather to: Discover some of SPS's evidence-informed correctional practices Share and learn about different jurisdictions' model of corrections See how we network with other correctional agencies As a leading correctional agency committed to enforcing the safe and secure custody of offenders and rehabilitating them, SPS regularly participates in local and international conferences on corrections to share about its practices on various topics, such as the development of evidence-informed rehabilitation programmes. We're also glad to have Assoc Prof , Minister of State, Minister of Home Affairs and Ministry of National Development, deliver the opening address on 25 September 2023. Speaking to the participants from 13 countries, MOS Faishal underscored that the ICLP is an important and meaningful platform to foster a culture of learning and collaboration for leaders of correctional agencies. ICLP2023 BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SPS SingaporePrisonService

At the Visual Arts Hub (VAH) in Changi Prison Complex, artistically inclined inmates receive training in different art forms to embrace art as a form of rehabilitation. Through this work programme, they are able to express themselves in their chosen craft, such as painting, pottery, batik painting and more. At the same time, it also offers an avenue for a second lease on life in the creative industry after their release. Let us know what you see in these art pieces! CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Our rehabilitation and reintegration efforts have always been boosted by the commitment and hard work of prison volunteers. Throughout the rehabilitation journey from incarceration to community reintegration, acceptance and support from a prosocial network are critical factors for second chances.Every year, we celebrate our selfless and dedicated prison volunteers at the Volunteer Awards Ceremony for their significant contributions towards the rehabilitation of inmates and ex-offenders.This year, 491 volunteers were recognised for providing a wide range of support, which created positive impact in the lives of inmates, ex-offenders, and their families.If you are keen to join these inspiring individuals and organisations as volunteers with the Singapore Prison Service, visit: for more details. Did you guess it right?Trainees at the Reformative Training Centre undergo a minimum detention period of 6 to 12 months, where they take ownership of their rehabilitation and embark on a journey of change. This will be part of their Reformative Training Sentence, which comprises a residential phase of up to 36 months and a supervision phase of up to 52 months.The programmes offered in the RTC include family programme, education, upskilling and job preparation, designed to meet the needs of each trainee. Starting a new life also means letting go of the past. The Singapore Prison Services (SPS) Gang Renunciation Programme empowers inmates to renounce their former gang ties as they prepare to reintegrate into society.More than 1,500 inmates have renounced their gang affiliations since the programme started in 2009. Aside from cutting ties with gangs, other supplementary programmes, such as tattoo removal, are also offered to provide additional forms of support, as they craft new identities for themselves. CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Through the Christian Counselling Services (CCS), David Siow met his mentor, Philip Lim, who saw him through important phases of his rehabilitation and reintegration journey. From education to volunteerism, and spirituality, David has moved beyond his past and now contributes to the community as a volunteer prison counsellor. Stories like these are what make the Throughcare Volunteer Framework (TVF) impactful, as the Singapore Prison Service (SPS) partners with more community volunteers to enhance pro-social support for inmates and ex-offenders, strengthening SPS's rehabilitation and reintegration efforts.CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

The Singapore Prison Service (SPS) partners the Centre for Fathering to facilitate card-writing sessions for incarcerated fathers to rebuild relationships with their children. For Father's Day this year, 227 inmates participated in this initiative to prepare cards to be sent to their family. Through these simple gestures, familial bonds are kept alive, maintaining a family support system that is integral to the rehabilitation and reintegration process. DidYouKnow? Motivational talks are conducted for Muslim inmates every quarter to inculcate important values and provide religious guidance to them.Fitrah , or Family and Inmates ThRoughcare Assistance Haven, is an office under the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis) .sg. As part of M, FITRAH and MUIS work closely with MENDAKI Singapore and People's Association Malay Activity Executive Committees Council (MESRA). During these sessions, inmates are provided with opportunities to share their stories and challenges. They can also engage the speakers to work towards personal growth and participate in other religious programmes.CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

During these sessions, inmates are provided with opportunities to share their stories and challenges. They can also engage the speakers to work towards personal growth and participate in other religious programmes.CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

Our heartiest congratulations to DSP Sameeyul Ameen S/O Haji Sulaiman for receiving the Public Sector Transformation (PST) Award for Exemplary Innovator and CW Muhammad Hashnul Nizam Bin Hassan for receiving the PST Award for Exemplary SkillsFuture during Public Service Week 2023. The theme of this year's Public Service Week is "Enriching your Experience, Transforming Our Service", and the Singapore Prison Service is especially proud of how both officers have exemplified the theme, in their own ways.Not only did DSP Sameeyul conceptualise and work with to prototype the first ever automated urine screening system in the world, he also championed collaborative learning within his team by promoting a 'purposeful coffee break' for staff to openly share their perspectives on any topic or impart new skills to their colleagues.For CW Muhammad Hashnul, his learning did not stop after he completed Polytechnic. To stay relevant, and also contribute meaningfully to SPS, he stretched his personal growth even further to get a Degree and is on his way towards attaining a Master's Degree! "One thing that I learnt in school was Abraham Maslows hierarchy of needs. Using the hierarchy of needs, I help the inmates that I work with to set goals for their reintegration plans. I realised that it is a useful tool to share with the inmates to keep them grounded," shared CW Muhammad Hashnul.CaptainsOfLives BeyondPrisonWalls BehindPrisonWallsPublicServiceWeek

Meet DSP Ravin Singh, an educator turned CaptainOfLives with a passion for making a difference! After teaching Geography at Meridian Junior College for seven years, DSP Ravin decided to pursue his interest with the uniformed services and joined the Singapore Prison Service (SPS) at the age of 32. After completing his training as a Senior Prison Officer, DSP Ravin was posted to the Reformative Training Centre, where he played a crucial role in rehabilitating young offenders. He then moved on to staff positions in the Operations Division and subsequently the Corporate Communications & Service Division, where he focused on policy management, prison regime processes, and enhancing SPS's media presence. Now into his eighth year of service, DSP Ravin has embraced the multiple roles within SPS wholeheartedly, from teacher to disciplinarian to mentor. "Contrary to what some may think, working in a prison is not a routine and boring job. It is a very dynamic job which helps develop you as a person and as a leader."Although he misses certain aspects of teaching, his new journey provides continuous learning, fresh challenges, and the chance to still make a difference in people's lives. In his current role, he finds joy in showcasing the good work done by the SPS through the media, while also appreciating the strong camaraderie and teamwork within the SPS.BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

DidYouKnow? Inmates in Singapore Prison Service's (SPS) Changi Prison Complex have access to various career and upskilling opportunities, including a work programme that is focused on logistics operations, where inmates explore working in a warehouse environment and learn to take on other logistical tasks. As part of the work programmes, inmates receive hands-on training as Warehouse Assistants, which aims to equip them with practical skills required for a career in the logistics industry. Upon their release, they can even request for testimonials based on their experience in this role to secure a better chance at gainful employment. Overseeing this work programme is our CaptainOfLives, CW Mohammad Sharil Abdullah, a Work Programme Officer who ensures the safe and secure custody of the inmates so that effective rehabilitation can take place.CW Sharil firmly believes in the positive impact of this programme on the lives of inmates. He said, "Witnessing their sense of ownership and pride in their work is truly fulfilling. We remain committed to offering continuous learning and growth opportunities for them." BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

DidYouKnowFor complex medical conditions, inmates from Changi Prison Complex can be referred and transported to Public Healthcare Institutions such as Changi General Hospital (CGH), so they receive the medical attention and treatment required. At CGH, inmates have access to the specialist services they require, including gastroenterology and hepatology, haemato-oncology, otorhinolaryngology and orthopaedic surgery.Chronic Hepatitis C and liver cirrhosis are frequently diagnosed among inmates as a result of prolonged substance abuse. To ensure continuity of care for inmates after their release, the Singapore Prison Service also arranges for ex-offenders to continue their medical follow up at CGH even after they have completed their sentences. CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

On 15 June 2023, the Grand Finale of the Yellow Ribbon Culinary Competition (YRCC) 2023 was held at Changi Prison Complex. The event was graced by , Senior Minister of State for Ministry of Sustainability and Environment & Ministry of Transport, along with key partners and sponsors of the event. In collaboration with and , the competition provides ex-offenders and inmates with a platform to strengthen relationships with their families through food, while learning valuable skills to pursue a career in the F&B industry after release. For over two months, teams worked alongside an alumnus from the HCSA Academy, leveraging their expertise to create delectable three-course meals using plant-based ingredients. All inmate participants received a token sum for their participation, and employers will be contacted to confer job placements to the top three teams upon their release.The winning dishes will also be adopted by catering company, Kitchen Haus Group Pte Ltd, as part of their catering menu. Congratulations to all inmate participants and ex-offenders who stepped out of their comfort zones to compete!YRCC2023 PlantingSeedsOfChange CaptainsOfLives BehindPrisonWalls BeyondPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances

On 8 June 2023, 16 dedicated Senior Prison Officers from Cohort 1/2022 attended the graduation ceremony at the Home Team Academy, as they completed their Rehabilitation Officer Conversion (ROC) Course at the Singapore Prison Training Institute (SPTI), and marked a new chapter in their careers. This year's Merit Award recipient, RO Kalwinderjeet Singh, a Senior Correctional Unit Officer at Institution Tanah Merah 1, exemplifies the spirit of unwavering commitment and personal growth. In his own words, "The ability and desire to upgrade oneself illustrates the dedication to ones career. I encourage all Prison Officers to constantly stay relevant and never stop learning." Having joined SPS in 2006 as a Sergeant, RO Kalwinderjeet's inspirational journey is testament to the power of continuous improvement. Congratulations to RO Kalwinderjeet and all Cohort 1/2022 ROC officers! You have demonstrated dedication to upgrading yourselves and achieving this leadership milestone. Your commitment, contributions, and experience are highly valued at SPS. BeyondPrisonWalls BehindPrisonWalls SG4SecondChances
